snippet: In New York City Ballet’s “Swan Lake,” “Allegro Brillante” and “Tschaikovsky Suite No. 3,” you can feel the many ways in which Balanchine choreography intensifies the Tchaikovsky experience.
abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews three ballets featuring music by Tchaikovsky, performed by New York City Ballet at David H Koch Theater.
lead_paragraph: In New York City Ballet’s “Swan Lake,” “Allegro Brillante” and “Tschaikovsky Suite No. 3,” you can feel the many ways in which Balanchine choreography intensifies the Tchaikovsky experience.

headline.seo: New York City Ballet at Koch Theater
headline.main: From Lakeside to Ballroom, Taking Tchaikovsky in Many Directions
headline.print_headline: From Lakeside to Ballroom, Taking Tchaikovsky in Many Directions
